Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease two 12-cup muffin pans or line the cups with paper liners.

Cream together the butter and sugar in a large bowl using an electric mixer until the mixture is light and airy. Incorporate half of the flour and half of the eggs; mix until smooth. Then add the rest of the flour and eggs, beating until the batter is light and fluffy.
Scoop the batter into the prepared muffin cups, ensuring each is filled about three-quarters full.
Bake in the preheated oven until the tops bounce back when gently pressed, approximately 10 to 12 minutes. Let cool in the tins for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
